title: What is an example of new technology from the time of the nomadic people? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have always been fascinated by Australian Aborigines. The technology that they used (Boomerangs and Woomera’s) look simple but they embody really sophisticated concepts. Boomerangs actually have true aerofoil sections to enable them to fly. It is almost Mad Maxish in a way. Imagine a much more technically sophisticated society colonising Australia tens of thousands of years ago but finding that the environment was so utterly savage and the available resources so limited that they could not maintain their level of civilisation and had to scale down in order to survive and only a hand full of the former knowledge survived.

The most immediate example I can think of is the use of camels from about 2,500B.C. This made it far easier to cross tough terrain like deserts that had begun expanding since North African Monsoons began failing around 6,000B.C.
